languages.text: {n}Капитан хмурится.{/n} "Персонаж местных легенд, так называемый "Немезит", покровитель угнетенных и бедняков. Еще в моем детстве отчаявшиеся рисовали на стенах его портреты в надежде призвать защитника, который бы наказал их обидчиков. За последние пять лет было у нас штук тринадцать "Немезитов". На всякий случай мы их всех... освободили от тяжести бренного тела".

traits.locale_text: {n}Капитан хмурится.{/n} "Персонаж местных легенд, так называемый "Немезит", покровитель угнетенных и бедняков. Еще в моем детстве отчаявшиеся рисовали на стенах его портреты в надежде призвать защитника, который бы наказал их обидчиков. За последние пять лет было у нас штук тринадцать "Немезитов". На всякий случай мы их всех... освободили от тяжести бренного тела".

languages.text: {n}The captain frowns.{/n} "It's a figure of local legend, known as Nemesite, protector of the poor and oppressed. Ever since I was a child, desperate people have been drawing his portrait on the walls hoping to summon a defender to punish those who wronged them. We've had thirteen or so fools calling themselves 'Nemesite' over the past five years. We... disburdened ourselves of them, just to be sure."
languages.original_text: {n}Капитан хмурится.{/n} "Персонаж местных легенд, так называемый "Немезит", покровитель угнетенных и бедняков. Еще в моем детстве отчаявшиеся рисовали на стенах его портреты в надежде призвать защитника, который бы наказал их обидчиков. За последние пять лет было у нас штук тринадцать "Немезитов". На всякий случай мы их всех... освободили от тяжести бренного тела".

traits.locale_text: {n}The captain frowns.{/n} "It's a figure of local legend, known as Nemesite, protector of the poor and oppressed. Ever since I was a child, desperate people have been drawing his portrait on the walls hoping to summon a defender to punish those who wronged them. We've had thirteen or so fools calling themselves 'Nemesite' over the past five years. We... disburdened ourselves of them, just to be sure."

{n}The captain tugs at his narrow collar.{/n} "Pay no attention. It's a figure of local legend, the so-called Nemesite, protector of the poor and oppressed. Even back when I was a child, desperate people painted his portraits on walls hoping to summon a defender to punish those who wronged them. We've had thirteen or so of these 'Nemesites' over the past five years. We disburdened them of their mortal shells... just to be sure."

Ever since I was a child, desperate people have been drawing his portrait on the walls hoping to summon a defender to punish those who wronged them. We've had thirteen or so people calling themself 'Nemesite' over the past five years. We disburdened them of their mortal shells... just to be sure."

Ever since I was a child, desperate people have been drawing his portrait on the walls hoping to summon a defender to punish those who wronged them. We've had thirteen or so fools calling themselves 'Nemesite' over the past five years. We... disburdened ourselves of them, just to be sure."

languages.text: {n}El capitán frunce el ceño.{/n} «Puede ignorarlo, señor{mf||a}. Es una figura legendaria local conocida como Nemesitio, protector de los pobres y los oprimidos. Desde que era niño, he visto a la gente desesperada retratarlo en los muros para invocar a un defensor que castigara a quienes los maltrataban. En los últimos cinco años, unos trece imbéciles han tomado su nombre. Nos... deshicimos de ellos, por si acaso».
languages.original_text: {n}The captain frowns.{/n} "It's a figure of local legend, known as Nemesite, protector of the poor and oppressed. Ever since I was a child, desperate people have been drawing his portrait on the walls hoping to summon a defender to punish those who wronged them. We've had thirteen or so fools calling themselves 'Nemesite' over the past five years. We... disburdened ourselves of them, just to be sure."

traits.locale_text: {n}El capitán frunce el ceño.{/n} «Puede ignorarlo, señor{mf||a}. Es una figura legendaria local conocida como Nemesitio, protector de los pobres y los oprimidos. Desde que era niño, he visto a la gente desesperada retratarlo en los muros para invocar a un defensor que castigara a quienes los maltrataban. En los últimos cinco años, unos trece imbéciles han tomado su nombre. Nos... deshicimos de ellos, por si acaso».

languages.text: {n}中隊長が眉をひそめる。{/n}「お気になさらないでください、陛下。それは現地の伝説の人物で、ネメサイトとして知られています。貧しく虐げられている者たちの庇護者なのです。私が子供のころから、絶望に瀕した人々が壁に彼のポートレートを描き、自分たちを不当に扱う者どもを罰してくれる庇護者が現れることを願っているのです。過去5年で自らを『ネメサイト』と称した者は、13人ほどおりました。我々は…念のために、彼らを始末した。」
languages.original_text: {n}The captain frowns.{/n} "It's a figure of local legend, known as Nemesite, protector of the poor and oppressed. Ever since I was a child, desperate people have been drawing his portrait on the walls hoping to summon a defender to punish those who wronged them. We've had thirteen or so fools calling themselves 'Nemesite' over the past five years. We... disburdened ourselves of them, just to be sure."

traits.locale_text: {n}中隊長が眉をひそめる。{/n}「お気になさらないでください、陛下。それは現地の伝説の人物で、ネメサイトとして知られています。貧しく虐げられている者たちの庇護者なのです。私が子供のころから、絶望に瀕した人々が壁に彼のポートレートを描き、自分たちを不当に扱う者どもを罰してくれる庇護者が現れることを願っているのです。過去5年で自らを『ネメサイト』と称した者は、13人ほどおりました。我々は…念のために、彼らを始末した。」

languages.text: {n}弗伦索上尉皱起了眉头。{/n}“那个人是当地传说中的人物，人们称他为涅墨斯特，相信他是穷人与受迫害者的守护者。从我还是个孩子的时候起，那些走投无路的人就会画他的肖像，希望能召唤某个正义的守护者，惩罚那些迫害他们的人。在过去的五年里，我们抓住了十三个自称涅墨斯特的蠢货。我们……为了保证万无一失，彻底解决掉了这些麻烦。”
languages.original_text: {n}The captain frowns.{/n} "It's a figure of local legend, known as Nemesite, protector of the poor and oppressed. Ever since I was a child, desperate people have been drawing his portrait on the walls hoping to summon a defender to punish those who wronged them. We've had thirteen or so fools calling themselves 'Nemesite' over the past five years. We... disburdened ourselves of them, just to be sure."

traits.locale_text: {n}弗伦索上尉皱起了眉头。{/n}“那个人是当地传说中的人物，人们称他为涅墨斯特，相信他是穷人与受迫害者的守护者。从我还是个孩子的时候起，那些走投无路的人就会画他的肖像，希望能召唤某个正义的守护者，惩罚那些迫害他们的人。在过去的五年里，我们抓住了十三个自称涅墨斯特的蠢货。我们……为了保证万无一失，彻底解决掉了这些麻烦。”

languages.text: {n}Der Captain runzelt die Stirn.{/n} "Eine Legendengestalt, die Nemesit genannt wird, der Beschützer der Armen und Unterdrückten. Seit ich ein Kind war, haben verzweifelte Leute sein Bild an die Wände gemalt, um einen Verteidiger zu rufen, der sie für alles erlittene Unrecht rächt. Wir hatten in den letzten fünf Jahren etwa dreizehn Idioten, die sich für Nemesit hielten. Wir ... haben uns ihrer entledigt. Sicher ist sicher.
languages.original_text: {n}The captain frowns.{/n} "It's a figure of local legend, known as Nemesite, protector of the poor and oppressed. Ever since I was a child, desperate people have been drawing his portrait on the walls hoping to summon a defender to punish those who wronged them. We've had thirteen or so fools calling themselves 'Nemesite' over the past five years. We... disburdened ourselves of them, just to be sure."

traits.locale_text: {n}Der Captain runzelt die Stirn.{/n} "Eine Legendengestalt, die Nemesit genannt wird, der Beschützer der Armen und Unterdrückten. Seit ich ein Kind war, haben verzweifelte Leute sein Bild an die Wände gemalt, um einen Verteidiger zu rufen, der sie für alles erlittene Unrecht rächt. Wir hatten in den letzten fünf Jahren etwa dreizehn Idioten, die sich für Nemesit hielten. Wir ... haben uns ihrer entledigt. Sicher ist sicher.

languages.text: {n}Le capitaine fronce les sourcils.{/n} « N'y prêtez pas attention. C'est une représentation d'une légende du coin appelée Némésite, protecteur des pauvres et des opprimés. Quand j'étais petit, des gens désespérés dessinaient déjà son portrait sur les murs dans l'espoir qu'un défenseur vienne punir ceux qui leur avaient fait du tort. Ces cinq dernières années, environ treize imbéciles ont prétendu être ce fameux Némésite. Par mesure de sécurité, nous nous en sommes... débarrassés. »
languages.original_text: {n}The captain frowns.{/n} "It's a figure of local legend, known as Nemesite, protector of the poor and oppressed. Ever since I was a child, desperate people have been drawing his portrait on the walls hoping to summon a defender to punish those who wronged them. We've had thirteen or so fools calling themselves 'Nemesite' over the past five years. We... disburdened ourselves of them, just to be sure."

traits.locale_text: {n}Le capitaine fronce les sourcils.{/n} « N'y prêtez pas attention. C'est une représentation d'une légende du coin appelée Némésite, protecteur des pauvres et des opprimés. Quand j'étais petit, des gens désespérés dessinaient déjà son portrait sur les murs dans l'espoir qu'un défenseur vienne punir ceux qui leur avaient fait du tort. Ces cinq dernières années, environ treize imbéciles ont prétendu être ce fameux Némésite. Par mesure de sécurité, nous nous en sommes... débarrassés. »

languages.text: {n}Yüzbaşı kaşlarını çatıyor.{/n} "Yerel efsanelere konu olmuş bir şahıs. Nemezit olarak bilinir. Yoksulların ve baskı görenlerin koruyucusudur. Çaresi kalmamış insanlar, küçüklüğümden beri duvarlara onun portresini çizer durur. Kendilerine yanlış yapanları cezalandıracak bir savunucu çağırmayı umarlar. Son beş yılda kendine 'Nemezit' diyen aşağı yukarı on üç tane ahmak çıktı. Biz de... Emin olmak adına onları başımızdan savıp kendimizi bu yükten kurtardık."
languages.original_text: {n}The captain frowns.{/n} "It's a figure of local legend, known as Nemesite, protector of the poor and oppressed. Ever since I was a child, desperate people have been drawing his portrait on the walls hoping to summon a defender to punish those who wronged them. We've had thirteen or so fools calling themselves 'Nemesite' over the past five years. We... disburdened ourselves of them, just to be sure."
